Reviews.Title: “Great location, hospitable staff”
Reviews.Author: Faith C
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the location-- right in the middle of a ton of nightlife right off Taksim Square, which is great since the old part of Istanbul shuts down pretty early, so at night you want to be in the newer area of the city. Easy to take public transportation to the old part of the city, or about a 45 minute walk from the hostel (definitely do-able). The staff was really helpful and suggested cheap (but good) places to eat for poor college kids like myself. The place they suggested was so good we actually ate there twice. The owner also upgraded our room to a dorm with less people for no extra charge. The room was clean, no frills but I didn't have high expectations since it was a hostel. Shower was ok, a little below par but it was fine for the couple days we were there.

Reviews.Title: “New Years Eve, Cant beat it!”
Reviews.Author: bgannon1230
Reviews.Content: I went with my wife and two other friends from 29 December-02 January. In this short amount of time is my birthday, my wedding anniversary and obviously new years so forgive me if i leave out any details as i was hammerd the whole time. YOU CANNOT BEAT THIS LOCATION FOR THE PRICE. we were given a room with a queen bed for me and my wife and bunk beds for my two friends. The cleanliness of the room was very good and the cleanliness of whole hostel was average. I am stationed in turkey so i am used to turkish standards. the only gripe i have is the stairs you have to climb to get to the top floors where our room was. the owner was very helpful and let us use his internet and phone when we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great value, clean and quiet place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Lief83
Reviews.Content: This was a great, clean, quiet and very central place to stay, with good breakfast, nice beds, clean bathrooms. I stayed in the dorms and it was absolutely worth it, and the location is truly fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it and I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: TTTDDK
Reviews.Content: Chambers of the Boheme is one of the best hostels I'v ever stayed at... and I travel often. The location is great for both day and night activities. The hostel has a relaxed atmosphere with a bit of a feeling of luxury due to the lovely furniture and decor. The staff were friendly and helpful and the owner went out of his way to assist me when i needed it. I wish I could have stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “Central Location, very so-so rooms”
Reviews.Author: goldengaterecordings
Reviews.Content: I stayed at a few locations throughout Istanbul during my travels in Turkey, and I can't say I liked this one very much. Nice enough people running the place, but sub-par furnishings. You must expect noise in this neighborhood, so nothing unexpected there. Luckily I was the only person in my room during my 2 nights there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: oli1406
Reviews.Content: Chambers of the Boheme is a great place for you if you are going to party in istanbul. If you're planning to rest or even just to have a normal nights sleep, don't even think about checking in this hostel. If you are a party animal, who won't go to bed until sunrise, then this is the perfect place for you. It seemed pretty secure to me and the small breakfast in the morning was delicious. Nice bread. I would certainly stay at this place again.

Reviews.Title: “in the heart of the action, full of character”
Reviews.Author: visitor255061
Reviews.Content: As with anywhere, it depends what you're after - it's cheap & interesting. The rooms are clean (toilet floors could be done more regularly), staff are helpful. The area is fun and busy, with a good mixture of locals and tourists.

Reviews.Title: “you can do better elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: SeattleTourist17
Reviews.Content: We had a recently finished private room---so recently finshed that there were no hooks in any of the walls for towels or clothing, there were workboat prints on the bathroom floor, and there was edging tape on the door lintel. We had to ask for towels and caryy our luggage up 3 flights of stairs. The hostel is in a great spot, just off Taksim Sq and is surrounded by bars, restaurants, and cafes. But it is surrounded by bars and cafes and so it is very, very noisy at night. There were nice sitting areas and internet service. But given the cost, this place just wasn't worth it unless you are in your twenties and don't mind sharing a room and not getting much sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great- saved us at the last minute!”
Reviews.Author: lightbright_ld
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at Chambers once before with 2 other friends, and we loved it. I booked a different hostel this time (only because this one was full) and it was the worst I've seen yet. So we walked over to Chambers in hopes of a cancellation, and although he was still booked he managed to fit us into an extra room in the building for the night. It was a lifesaver, and was even a better rate than the other. The hostel is right near everything in Beyoglu, with clubs, bars, cafes, and shopping. The owner is funny and helpful, and there are usually interesting and friendly people staying there. Not to mention, it's really clean! You might hear some music at night from nearby, but the hostel itself is pretty quiet and it's worth the location. Free wifi and a computer in the lobby. Take the Havas bus from the airport to Taksim, and it's just a 10 min walk to the hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hostel!”
Reviews.Author: Thite-Boarh
Reviews.Content: Before arriving at the hostel we had read some reviews, which said that there was too much noise and too many mosquitoes. This made us a bit anxious but it never became a problem. Because let's face it. If you want to live in such a lively amazing part of this wonderful city at this time of the year - there HAS to be some (or should I say a lot of) noise and there HAS to be mosquitoes. And we slept all 5 nights with no issues. The people we met at this hostel were amazing and it really didn't matter wether there was no lockers or not. We pretty much trusted each other. But I can see it beeing an issue if you cannot trust your roommates - and sometimes you just can't. Another good thing is the fact that they serve breakfast 'till 10.30! That's a treat! We managed to get out of bed and get down at the cafe 10.25 every day just to get the egg, the bread, the tomato, the cucumber and the olives;) The only thing that did bother us was Ahmed the owner. You must remember always to say hello and pay a lot attention to him and what he is saying. He seemed to have a hard time understanding that we had other things to do in Istanbul than to sit and hang out with him every night... But overall he seemed to be a great guy who will do a lot to please his customers.

Reviews.Title: “hmm...”
Reviews.Author: Ross1970
Reviews.Content: Everything written in the previous comment is true, only the author forgot to mention the backside of those pluses: the hostel is truly located Ä±n a wonderful spot, 2 minutes away from Taksim and right on the Istiklal and you can't really move in the neighborhoud without bumping into the next club, bar, cafe, etc. This is great if socialÄ±zing is your only gol, however, if you've spent the day sightseing and are tired and want to rest, well, forget about it. Not till early morning, at least. Security was another issue: there are no lockers in the hostel. Last but not least, some social, political ideas of its owner Ahmet are rather... doubtful. If you happen to stay there ask him what he think about blacks or women rÄ±ght, or gipsies, and so on.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Mathilde1212
Reviews.Content: This place is the perfect place to stay if you are looking for a location in Taksim: clean, quiet when you come back from a night in clubs, welcoming, exceptionnaly located. Nothing to say except from excellent!

HotelInfo.Name: Chambers of the Boheme
HotelInfo.Address: Kucukparmakkapi Sokak No 23, Istanbul 80200, Turkey
